meanings.definition: To become limp or drooping, as a fading flower.
meanings.sent1: After being under the hot sun all day, the flowers in the garden were wilting.
meanings.sent2: The plants in the greenhouse were wilting due to lack of water.
meanings.sent3: The wilting flowers looked like they were taking a nap in the afternoon sun.
meanings.sent4: Her spirits were wilting like a flower without water, losing their vitality.
meanings.sent5: The image of the wilting flowers stayed with her, a reminder of the fragility of life.

meanings.sent1: The team's performance was wilting under the pressure of the championship game.
meanings.sent2: His enthusiasm for the project was wilting as the deadlines approached.
meanings.sent3: The wilting energy of the tired puppy made everyone smile at his adorable laziness.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence was wilting like a flower in the scorching heat of self-doubt.
meanings.sent5: The wilting determination in his eyes showed that he needed a break to recharge.
